left.text: quick tyrannous, how may megabytes are in one gigabyte

right.text: to be honest i don't know how many there are, and i don't give a fuck

left.text: dn dn dn you failed the trick question

panels.narration: (i know this isn't funny, but it's mainly for context)

right.text: whatever. it's no use to me

left.text: it's like troy ounces. hd manufacturers use decimal for gigabytes, so 1000 mb = 1 gb because it looks like MORE, whereas windows measures in binary (1024) so 5 gb magically disappears
